      Generates randomly the ladders with amount typed by the user
      void createNext(Square prev)
      Creates the whole board, making the next either the one on the right side, or above or on the left, the first one its the bottom row first column, where the players begin to play normally
      void createSnakes(int snakes)
      Generates randomly the amount of snakes typed by the user
      Square exchange(Square old, Square newList)
      We need to know that the method that gets all the squares in an specified row adds them in the order that it founds them, so it will be unsorted sometimes, to sort and to avoid making a pretty complicated method it just inverts the order of the list, making the last one the first, the one before the last one the second one, etc.

      Player startMovement(int moves)
      Start the movement of the players through the board in order (moves the first player typed in the menu) then it adds 1 to the counter to move to let the method know what player moves next

      • show

      • startMovement

        public Player startMovement(int moves)
        Start the movement of the players through the board in order (moves the first player typed in the menu) then it adds 1 to the counter to move to let the method know what player moves next
        Parameters:
        moves - The amount of moves of the player
        Returns:
        The player that won if its the case, otherwise returns null

        Creates the first square and calls the method to create the whole board

      • checkSnakes

        public boolean checkSnakes(int initRow,
                           int initCol,
                           int endRow,
                           int endCol)
        Checks if the numbers given are proper for the creation of a Snake. Also checks that the number its not out of bounds
        Parameters:
        initRow - the number of the row for the start of the snake
        initCol - the number of the column for the start of the snake
        endRow - the number of the row for the end of the snake
        endCol - the number of the column for the end of the snake
        Returns:
        If the numbers are ok with all the conditions

      • setPlayers

        public void setPlayers(java.lang.String playersString)
        Splits up the String with the players's symbols and adds these symbols to the Player linked list
        Parameters:
        playersString - Its the String with all the symbols of the players

      • setPlayersOnBoard

        public void setPlayersOnBoard()

      • showBoard

        public void showBoard(int requestedRow)
        Prints the an specified row of the board with the number of the squares, ladders and snakes (without the players)
        Parameters:
        requestedRow - Its the number of the row that its going to be shown

      • showActualBoard

        public void showActualBoard(int requestedRow)
        Prints an specified row with the players placed on them, the snakes and the ladders
        Parameters:
        requestedRow - Its the number of the row that its going to be shown

      • recursiveRows

        public void recursiveRows(int rows)
        It calls the method to a row with every row, shows the state with the numbers of the squares, snakes and ladders
        Parameters:
        rows - Its the number of the row to show, it starts ALWAYS with 0

      • showActual

        public void showActual(int rows)
        It calls the method to a row with every row, shows the state with the Players of the squares, snakes and ladders
        Parameters:
        rows - Its the number of the row to show, it starts ALWAYS with 0

        Returns:

      • createNext

        public void createNext(Square prev)
        Creates the whole board, making the next either the one on the right side, or above or on the left, the first one its the bottom row first column, where the players begin to play normally
        Parameters:
        prev - The square that will get the next square

      • sortList

        public Square sortList(Square a)
        Check if the linked list with an specified row has its squares in order(based on their columns)
        Parameters:
        a - Its the linked list with squares of an specified row
        Returns:
        The linked list itself or calls another method to sort it

      • exchange

        public Square exchange(Square old,
                       Square newList)
        We need to know that the method that gets all the squares in an specified row adds them in the order that it founds them, so it will be unsorted sometimes, to sort and to avoid making a pretty complicated method it just inverts the order of the list, making the last one the first, the one before the last one the second one, etc.
        Parameters:
        old - Its the old linked list with the unsorted list
        newList - the new Linked List of Squares with the new Order
